snippet: The ambitious mission succeeded, despite a potential showstopper problem, when a signal arrived at Darmstadt, Germany, just after 11 a.m. Eastern time.
abstract: European Space Agency's Rosetta mission successfully places small spacecraft on surface of Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko; technological feat gives scientists first opportunity to study comet close-up, rather than as distant object speeding across sky.
lead_paragraph: The ambitious mission succeeded, despite a potential showstopper problem, when a signal arrived at Darmstadt, Germany, just after 11 a.m. Eastern time.

headline.main: Landing on a Comet, a European Space Agency Mission Aims to Unlock the Mysteries of Earth
headline.print_headline: Landing on a Comet, a Mission Aims to Unlock the Mysteries of Earth
